p: Most people associate fires with dry and warm weather. Major conflagrations have, however, also been experienced during the winter time. The most severe conflagration in modern times in Norway, i.e., the Ålesund conflagration, 23 January 1904, may serve as an example. That fire became out of control in storm strength wind (22–30 m/s wind speed), killed one person, destroyed 850 out of 1080 structures and resulted in 10,000–12,000 homeless people [ 1].
